alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 12:10PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nevada... Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and produce elevated flows in Lamoille Creek. An active weather pattern will persist into next week with the potential that a thunderstorm capable of producing heavy rainfall may affect the Lamoille creek drainage and cause a sudden increase in flows. For the Lamoille Creek...including Lamoille...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.8 feet, Flood stage at the powerhouse gage location in lamoille canyon. Minor flooding can occur in the town of lamoille. Water can seep into basements near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:40 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:40 PM PDT Friday was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.0 feet. - Flood stage is 4.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1030 AM PDT.
